<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company's net deferred income tax liability was $91.3&nbsp;million and $87.3&nbsp;million at February&nbsp;1, 2003 and February&nbsp;2, 2002, respectively, and included a
valuation allowance of $5.9&nbsp;million at both fiscal year ends primarily related to net operating losses that may not be utilized in the carryforward period. As a result of the exchange of the
Predecessor Company's subordinated debt and accrued interest for the Successor Company's equity in fiscal 2001, the amount of the Company's aggregate indebtedness was reduced, generating income from
the cancellation of debt for tax purposes of approximately $350&nbsp;million. Since the realization of such income occurred under the U. S. Bankruptcy Code, the Company did not recognize income from
cancellation of debt for tax purposes, but has elected to reduce the basis of its depreciable property and, with the remaining income from the cancellation of debt, reduce its tax loss carryforwards.
The Company's remaining federal tax loss carryforwards expire from fiscal 2008 through fiscal 2020 and are subject to an annual limitation of </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>46</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=46,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="1",CHK=519683,FOLIO='46',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]FM4370A.;21',USER='SMENEZE',CD='28-APR-2003;14:20' -->
<A NAME="page_fm4370_1_47"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>approximately
$38.6&nbsp;million due to the change of control resulting from the Plan of Reorganization. General business credits consist of federal work incentive credits and expire in fiscal 2008
through fiscal 2017. The fiscal 2002 income tax provision includes a charge of $2.6&nbsp;million to adjust the Company's estimated liability for certain tax issues. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
balance sheet classification of the deferred income tax assets and liabilities is as follows (in millions): </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income
tax payments were $4.1&nbsp;million for the 52 weeks ended February&nbsp;1, 2003, $1.0&nbsp;million for the 52 weeks ended February&nbsp;2, 2002, $0.1&nbsp;million for
the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001 and $0.1&nbsp;million for the 33 weeks ended September&nbsp;16, 2000. Income tax refunds were $2.6&nbsp;million for the 52 weeks ended
February&nbsp;1, 2003, $15,000 for the 52 weeks ended February&nbsp;2, 2002, $0.1&nbsp;million for the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001 and $0.4&nbsp;million for the 33 weeks ended
September&nbsp;16, 2000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Internal Revenue Service has closed its audits of the Company's tax returns through fiscal 1998. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;20.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Extraordinary Items  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In fiscal 2001, the Successor Company's extraordinary item of $3.3&nbsp;million, net of an income tax benefit of $2.3&nbsp;million, represents costs incurred
resulting from the early extinguishment of debt, including the write-off of deferred financing costs, related to the pay down of the term loan from certain of the proceeds of the Senior
Subordinated Notes. In the 33 weeks ended September&nbsp;16, 2000, the Predecessor Company's extraordinary item of $313.7&nbsp;million, net of an income tax provision of $46.6&nbsp;million,
represents income from the cancellation of debt related to the exchange of bond indebtedness and accrued interest for common stock and warrants in accordance with the Plan of Reorganization; such
income is reduced by the write-off of deferred financing costs related to the former bank credit facility and bond indebtedness subject to exchange. The income tax provision related to the
extraordinary item is based on the deferred tax impact of the tax attribute reductions, net of the valuation allowance reversal related to certain deferred tax assets. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
April&nbsp;2002, the FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;145, "Recession of FASB Statements 4, 44 and 64, Amendment of FASB Statement No.&nbsp;13, and Technical Corrections." The
provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;145 related to classification of debt extinguishments are effective for fiscal years beginning after May&nbsp;15, 2002. We intend to implement SFAS No.&nbsp;145 in
fiscal 2003 by applying APB Opinion No.&nbsp;30 to all gains and losses related to extinguishment of debt. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>47</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;21.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capital Stock  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Preferred Stock.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of February&nbsp;1, 2003 and February&nbsp;2, 2002, there were 5,000,000 shares of preferred stock
authorized of which none are issued or outstanding. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
part of the Plan of Reorganization, the Predecessor Company's subordinated debt and accrued interest of approximately $1&nbsp;billion was canceled and the holders of such
subordinated debt received 30,000,000 shares, representing 100% of the outstanding common stock of the reorganized Company and holders of certain subordinated debt also received warrants to purchase
up to 5,294,118 shares of common stock at $22.31 per share. Such warrants have a term of ten years from the Plan Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shares
of common stock issued pursuant to the Plan of Reorganization are subject to dilution from (1)&nbsp;the exercise of the warrants, and (2)&nbsp;the exercise of any options to
purchase common stock issued pursuant to the Company's Employee Plan and Directors' Plan (see Note&nbsp;22). The Company's common stock and warrants trade on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the ticker
symbols "PTMK" and "PTMKW", respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Restricted Stock.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company includes restricted stock awards in its earnings per share&#151;basic computation when
vested and earnings per share&#151;diluted computation when granted, provided that continued employment is the only condition for vesting. A restricted stock award of 98,510 shares with a fair
value of $1.2&nbsp;million was granted to the former Chief Executive Officer on October&nbsp;3, 2000, which was fully vested on January&nbsp;2, 2002. Under the terms of the restricted shares
issued, continued employment was the only condition for vesting. Upon vesting, 46,053 shares were surrendered to the Company to satisfy the tax withholding obligation and such shares were recorded as
treasury stock at a cost of $1.2&nbsp;million. The Company charged $0.8&nbsp;million and $0.4&nbsp;million to compensation expense in fiscal 2001 and the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001,
respectively, for this award. No restricted stock awards were made in fiscal 2002 or fiscal 2001. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;22.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock Option Plans  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2000 Employee Equity Plan (the "Employee Plan") and the 2000 Non-Employee Directors' Equity Plan (the "Directors' Plan"), which were implemented
as of the Plan Effective Date, make available the granting of options aggregating 5,294,118 shares of common stock, of which 5,164,118 shares are available under the Employee Plan and 130,000 shares
are available under the Directors' Plan. All of the Company's officers and certain employees are eligible to receive options under the Employee Plan. Options for additional shares may be granted by
the Board of Directors' Compensation Committee. The Directors' Plan is available to the Company's directors, who are not employees of the Company. As of February&nbsp;1, 2003, the number of options
outstanding for the Company's Employee Plan and Directors' Plan were 5,061,530 options with a weighted average exercise price of $12.07 and a weighted average contractual life of 8.7&nbsp;years of
which 1,069,107 options were exercisable. There were 213,853 shares of common stock available for future grant under the Company's Employee Plan and Directors' Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>48</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_fm4370_1_49"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options
which are designated as incentive stock options under the Employee Plan may be granted with an exercise price not less than the fair market value of the underlying shares at the
date of grant, as defined in the plan document, and are subject to certain quantity and other limitations specified in Section&nbsp;422 of the
Internal Revenue Code. Options which are not intended to qualify as incentive stock options may be granted at any price, but not less than the par value of the underlying shares and without
restriction as to amount. The options and the underlying shares are subject to adjustment in accordance with the terms of each plan in the event of stock dividends, recapitalization and similar
transactions. The options granted under the Employee </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>49</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=49,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="1",CHK=978553,FOLIO='49',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]FM4370A.;21',USER='SMENEZE',CD='28-APR-2003;14:20' -->
<A NAME="page_fm4370_1_50"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Plan
and the Directors' Plan expire ten years and five years after the date of grant, respectively, unless terminated earlier by the Company's Board of Directors. The right to exercise the options
granted vests in annual increments over four years under the Employee Plan and over three years under the Directors' Plan from the date of the grant. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has elected APB Opinion No.&nbsp;25 and selected interpretations in accounting for each of its stock option plans. Accordingly, as all options have been granted at exercise
prices equal to the fair market value on the date of grant, as defined in each stock option plan document, no compensation expense has been recognized by the Company in connection with its stock-based
compensation plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SFAS
No.&nbsp;123, "Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation," as amended by SFAS No.&nbsp;148, requires the disclosure of pro forma net earnings and net earnings per share as if the
Company had adopted the fair value method. Under SFAS No.&nbsp;123, the fair value of stock-based awards to employees is calculated through the use of option pricing models, even though such models
were developed to estimate the fair value of freely tradable, fully transferable options without vesting restrictions, which significantly differ from the Company's stock option awards. These models
also require subjective assumptions, including future stock price volatility and expected time to exercise, which greatly affect the calculated values. The weighted average fair value of the stock
options granted during fiscal 2002, fiscal 2001 and the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001 were $3.28, $5.83 and $4.56, respectively. The Company's fair value calculations were made using the
Black-Scholes option pricing model on the date of the grant with the following weighted average assumptions for fiscal 2002, fiscal 2001 and the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001, respectively:
risk free interest rates of 2.8%, 4.2% and 5.7%, expected lives of four years for each period; expected volatility of 58.5%, 30.5% and 30.0%; and an expected dividend yield of zero for each period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company's fair value calculations are based on a single-option valuation approach and forfeitures are recognized as they occur. Had compensation cost for the Company's stock option
plans been determined based on the fair value at the grant date for awards, consistent with the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;123, the Company's net earnings (loss) and net earnings (loss) per share
would have been reduced to the pro forma amounts disclosed in Note&nbsp;2. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;23.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reorganization Income (Expenses)  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Successor Company's reorganization income of $7.4&nbsp;million for the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001 represented a gain related to the difference
between the settled lessor claims for rejected leases and the liability previously recorded for such claims. The Predecessor Company's reorganization expenses of $0.9&nbsp;million for the 33 weeks
ended September&nbsp;16, 2000 were comprised of $19.1&nbsp;million of employee retention bonuses and professional fees related to legal, accounting and consulting services directly attributable to
the
Plan of Reorganization, net of a gain of $18.2&nbsp;million related to the difference between the estimated lessor claims for rejected leases and the liabilities previously recorded for such leases. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>50</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=50,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="1",CHK=323584,FOLIO='50',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]FM4370A.;21',USER='SMENEZE',CD='28-APR-2003;14:20' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_fo4370_1_51"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="fo4370_note_24._consolidating_financial_information"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_fo4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;24. Consolidating Financial Information    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following represents the consolidating financial statements of Pathmark and its 100% owned guarantor and nonguarantor subsidiaries. The guarantor subsidiaries
are comprised of six 100% owned entities, including Pathmark's distribution subsidiary, and guarantee on a full and unconditional and joint and several basis, the Senior Subordinated Notes. The
nonguarantor subsidiaries are comprised of four 100% owned single-purpose entities. Each of these entities owns the real estate on which a supermarket leased to Pathmark is located. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="35%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Pathmark</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Guarantor<BR>
Subsidiaries</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>55</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=55,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="1",CHK=698449,FOLIO='55',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]FR4370A.;5',USER='MKEANE',CD='28-APR-2003;09:42' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_fs4370_1_56"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;25. Commitments and Contingencies  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Outsourcing Agreements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In April&nbsp;2001, the Company entered into a five-year outsourcing agreement with
International Business Machines Corporation ("IBM") to continue to provide a wide range of information systems services, which commenced in 1991. Under the agreement, IBM provides data center
operations, mainframe processing, business applications and systems development to enhance the Company's customer service and efficiency. The charges under this agreement are based upon the services
requested at predetermined rates. The Company may terminate the agreement upon 90&nbsp;days notice with a payment of a specified termination charge. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has a 15-year supply agreement with C&amp;S Wholesalers,&nbsp;Inc. ("C&amp;S"), expiring in fiscal 2013, pursuant to which C&amp;S supplies substantially all of the
Company's grocery, frozen and perishable merchandise requirements. Under this arrangement with C&amp;S, the Company negotiate prices, discounts and promotions with vendors. During fiscal 2002, the
products supplied from C&amp;S accounted for approximately 60% of all the Company's supermarket inventory purchases. This agreement may be terminated for cause or certain events of bankruptcy by either
party. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company also has an agreement, expiring in fiscal 2014, with a local trucking company to provide trucking services for the Company. The Company may terminate the agreement with a
payment of a specified termination charge. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contingencies.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is a party to a number of legal proceedings in the ordinary course of business. Management
believes that the ultimate resolution of these proceedings will not, in the aggregate, have a material adverse effect on the Company's financial statements taken as a whole. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has taken certain tax positions, which may be challenged, and has reserved for such tax positions. While the ultimate resolution of these positions cannot be determined with
any degree of certainty, management believes that the aggregate liability, if any, when compared to the amounts reserved by the Company, will not have a material effect on the Company's financial
statements taken as a whole. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Guarantees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the normal course of business, the Company has assigned to third parties various leases related to former
businesses that the Company sold as well as former operating Pathmark supermarkets (the "Assigned Leases"). If any of the assignees were to become unable to continue making payments under the Assigned
Leases, the Company could be required to assume the lease obligation. As of February&nbsp;1, 2003, 64 Assigned Leases remain in place. Assuming that each respective assignee became unable to
continue to make payments under an Assigned Lease, an event the Company believes to be remote, management estimates its maximum potential obligation with respect to the Assigned Leases to be
approximately $84&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>56</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=57,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="1",CHK=209581,FOLIO='57',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]FS4370A.;9',USER='MKEANE',CD='28-APR-2003;09:42' -->

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="fu4370_independent_auditors__report"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_fu4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Independent Auditors' Report    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Board
of Directors and Shareholders of<BR>
Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries (the "Company") as of February&nbsp;1, 2003 and February&nbsp;2, 2002
(Successor Company) and the related consolidated statements of operations, stockholders' equity (deficiency) and cash flows for the 52 weeks ended February&nbsp;1, 2003, 52 weeks ended
February&nbsp;2, 2002, the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001 (Successor Company) and the 33 weeks ended September&nbsp;16, 2000 (Predecessor Company). These financial statements are the
responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
conducted our audits in accordance with auditing standards generally accepted in the United States of America. Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain
reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.
We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
our opinion, the Successor Company consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of the Company as of
February&nbsp;1, 2003 and February&nbsp;2, 2002, and the results of its consolidated operations and its consolidated cash flows for the 52 weeks ended February&nbsp;1, 2003, 52 weeks ended
February&nbsp;2, 2002 and the 20 weeks ended February&nbsp;3, 2001, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. Further, in our opinion, the
Predecessor Company consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the results of its consolidated operations and its consolidated cash flows for the 33 weeks ended
September&nbsp;16, 2000, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
discussed in Note&nbsp;1 to the consolidated financial statements, the Company completed its plan of reorganization and formally exited Chapter 11 on September&nbsp;19, 2000.
Accordingly, the accompanying financial statements have been prepared in conformity with AICPA Statement of Position 90-7, "Financial Reporting for Entities in Reorganization Under the
Bankruptcy Code," for the Successor Company as a new entity with assets, liabilities, and a capital structure having carrying values not comparable with prior periods as described in Note&nbsp;1. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
discussed in Note&nbsp;2 to the consolidated financial statements, in fiscal 2002, the Company changed its method of accounting for goodwill and other intangible assets to conform
to Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;142, "Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
discussed in Note&nbsp;2 to the consolidated financial statements, effective as of February&nbsp;3, 2002, the Company changed its method of accounting for cash consideration
received from vendors to comply with Emerging Issues Task Force Issue No.&nbsp;02-16, "Accounting by a Customer (Including a Reseller) for Certain Consideration Received from a Vendor." </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>Deloitte&nbsp;&amp;
Touche LLP<BR>
New York, New York<BR>
April&nbsp;1, 2003 </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>58</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ja4370_item_14._controls_and_procedures"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ja4370_7"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Within 90&nbsp;days before the filing of this Form&nbsp;10-K, under the supervision and with the participation of the Company's management,
including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, we carried out an evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company's disclosure controls and procedures
pursuant to Rule&nbsp;13(a)-14(c) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Based upon that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that the Company's
disclosure controls and procedures are effective in timely alerting them to material information required to be included in the Company's periodic SEC filings. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
have been no significant changes in the Company's internal controls or in other factors that could significantly affect these controls subsequent to the date of their evaluation. </FONT></P>

NAME="page_je4370_1_61"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="je4370_certifications"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_je4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Certifications    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Eileen R. Scott, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of
the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements and other financial information included in this annual report fairly present, in all material respects, the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this annual report.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officers and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and we have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated
subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this annual report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90&nbsp;days prior to the filing date of this
annual report (the "Evaluation Date"); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>presented
in this annual report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures based on our evaluation as of the
Evaluation Date. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of registrant's board of
directors (or persons performing the equivalent function):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process,
summarize and report financial data and have identified for the registrant's auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal controls. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officers and I have indicated in this annual report whether or not there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that could
significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weaknesses. </FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03NYC4370_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc4370_exhibit_10.27"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.27    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc4370_amendment_no._3_to_the_credit_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc4370_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 3 TO THE CREDIT AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AMENDMENT NO. 3 dated as of January&nbsp;28, 2003 in respect of the Credit Agreement dated as of September&nbsp;19, 2000 (as amended, modified, supplemented
and in effect from time to time, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Credit Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") among PATHMARK STORES,&nbsp;INC. (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Borrower</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the LENDERS party thereto (individually, a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" and collectively, the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lenders</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and JPMORGAN CHASE BANK (formerly known as The Chase Manhattan Bank), as Administrative Agent (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Administrative
Agent</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Borrower has requested that the Administrative Agent consent to certain amendments to the Credit Agreement and waive certain Defaults thereunder. The Administrative Agent, pursuant
to authority granted by, and having obtained all necessary consents of, the Required Lenders (as defined in the Credit Agreement), has agreed to such amendments and waiver and, accordingly, the
parties hereto hereby agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise defined in this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, terms defined in the
Credit Agreement are used herein as defined therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the conditions precedent set forth in Section&nbsp;5 below, but
effective as of the date hereof, the Credit Agreement shall be amended as follows: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.01.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;References
in the Credit Agreement (including references to the Credit Agreement as amended hereby) to "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>this Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"
(and indirect references such as "hereunder", "hereby", "herein" and "hereof") shall be deemed to be a reference to the Credit Agreement as amended hereby. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.02.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.01 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;adding
the following new definitions and inserting the same in the appropriate alphabetical locations to read in their entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Applicable Commitment Fee Rate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, (a)&nbsp;for each day during the period from and including the Effective Date to but excluding
January&nbsp;28, 2003, <SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>2</SMALL> of 1%, and (b)&nbsp;for January&nbsp;28, 2003 and every day thereafter, <SUP>3</SUP>/<SMALL>4</SMALL> of 1%. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Cash Flow</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any period, the result of Consolidated EBITDA for such period </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>minus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
Capital Expenditures referred to in clause&nbsp;(i) of the definition of the term "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Capital Expenditures</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" for such period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Fixed Charges Ratio</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, on any date, the ratio of (a)&nbsp;Cash Flow for the period of four consecutive fiscal quarters most
recently ended as of such date to (b)&nbsp;Consolidated Interest Expense for such period. </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>amending
the chart in the definition of "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Applicable Rate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="2",CHK=550533,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]KC4370A.;11',USER='MKEANE',CD='28-APR-2003;09:42' -->
<A NAME="page_kc4370_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.03.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Commitment Fee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.12(a) of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended to read in its entirety
as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"(a)
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Commitment Fee</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Borrower agrees to pay to the Administrative Agent for the account of each Lender a commitment fee,
which shall accrue at a rate per annum equal to the Applicable Commitment Fee Rate on the average daily unused amount of the Revolving Commitment of such Lender during the period from and including
the Effective Date to but excluding the date on which such Commitment terminates. Accrued commitment fees shall be payable in arrears on the 15th day of January, April, July and October of each year
and on the date on which the Revolving Commitments terminate, commencing on the first such date to occur after the date hereof. All commitment fees shall be computed on the basis of a year of
360&nbsp;days and shall be payable for the actual number of days elapsed (including the first day but excluding the last day). For purposes of computing commitment fees with respect to Revolving
Commitments, a Revolving Commitment of a Lender shall be deemed to be used to the extent of the outstanding Revolving Loans and LC Exposure of such Lender (and the Swingline Exposure of such Lender
shall be disregarded for such purpose)." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.04.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Review of Real Property Assets.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5.13 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended by inserting
a new paragraph&nbsp;(e) therein reading in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"(e)
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Review of Real Property Assets</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Borrower acknowledges that the Administrative Agent intends to engage a third party,
reasonably acceptable to the Borrower, to conduct a review and evaluation relating to the Real Property Assets, generally consistent in scope with the review and evaluation of the Real Property Assets
undertaken in connection with the execution and delivery of this Agreement on or about the Effective Date. The Borrower acknowledges that such review and evaluation will commence as soon as reasonably
practicable on or after January&nbsp;28, 2003 and the Administrative Agent intends that such review and evaluation will be completed and that its results will be made available to the Lenders by
March&nbsp;31, 2003. In that connection the Borrower will, and will cause each of its Subsidiaries to, cooperate in all respects with the Administrative Agent and such third parties to enable such
review and evaluation to be timely completed in a manner satisfactory to the Administrative Agent and the Lenders and will not, and will cause each of its Subsidiaries not to, cause such review and
evaluation to be hindered, impeded or delayed. Without limiting the foregoing </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="2",CHK=288678,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]KC4370A.;11',USER='MKEANE',CD='28-APR-2003;09:42' -->
<A NAME="page_kc4370_1_3"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
or Section&nbsp;5.09, the Borrower will, and will cause each of its Subsidiaries to, permit representatives designated by the Administrative Agent or such third parties, upon reasonable prior
notice, to visit and inspect its properties, to examine and make extracts from its books and records, and to discuss the Real Property Assets with its officers and any lessors of Real Property Assets,
all as often as reasonably requested. The cost of such review and evaluation shall be borne by the Borrower." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.08.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed Charges Ratio.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A new Section&nbsp;6.19 is hereby added at the end of Article&nbsp;VI of the
Credit Agreement to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="2",CHK=393042,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]KC4370A.;11',USER='MKEANE',CD='28-APR-2003;09:42' -->
<A NAME="page_kc4370_1_5"> </A>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"SECTION
6.19.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed Charges Ratio.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Borrower will not permit the Fixed Charges Ratio for any
four-fiscal-quarter period to be less than 1.00 to 1.00." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Waiver.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the conditions precedent set forth in Section&nbsp;5 below, the
Administrative Agent hereby waives any Default that occurs or has occurred during the period from and including the Effective Date to but excluding March&nbsp;31, 2003 arising out of the failure of
the Borrower to cause any Real Property Assets acquired by the Borrower or any Subsidiary Loan Party after the Effective Date to be subjected to a Lien securing the Obligations. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations and Warranties.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Borrower represents and warrants to the Lenders that: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;this
Amendment No.&nbsp;3 has been duly and validly executed and delivered by the Borrower and constitutes the Borrower's legal, valid and binding obligation,
enforceable against the Borrower in accordance with its terms; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;on
the date hereof, after giving effect to this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, no Default has occurred and be continuing; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
representations and warranties set forth in Article&nbsp;3 of the Credit Agreement are true and correct in all material respects on and as of the date hereof after
giving effect to this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, except to the extent such representations and warranties specifically relate to an earlier date, in which case such representations and warranties shall
have been true, correct and complete in all material respects on and as of such earlier date and as if each reference in said Article&nbsp;3 to "this Agreement" included reference to the Credit
Agreement. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>It
shall be an Event of Default for all purposes of the Credit Agreement, as amended hereby, if any representation, warranty or certification made by the Borrower in this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, or in
any certificate or other writing furnished to any Lender or the Administrative Agent pursuant to this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, shall prove to have been false or misleading as of the time made or
furnished in any material respect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendments to the Credit Agreement set forth in Section&nbsp;2 hereof and
the waiver set forth in Section&nbsp;3 hereof shall become effective, as of the date hereof, upon the satisfaction of the following conditions precedent: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.01.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Execution by All Parties.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Administrative Agent (or its counsel) shall have received either
(i)&nbsp;a counterpart of this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 signed on behalf of the Borrower and the Administrative Agent, with the consent of the Required Lenders, and the Consent and Agreement to
Amendment signed on
behalf of the Loan Parties thereto or (ii)&nbsp;written evidence satisfactory to the Administrative Agent (which may include telecopy transmission of a signed signature page of this Amendment
No.&nbsp;3) that such party has signed a counterpart of this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 and the Consent and Agreement to Amendment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.02.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Documents.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Administrative Agent shall have received the following documents, each of which shall be
satisfactory to the Administrative Agent in form and substance: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2109331",CP="PATHMARK STORES, INC.",DN="2",CHK=945759,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK038:[03NYC0.03NYC4370]KC4370A.;11',USER='MKEANE',CD='28-APR-2003;09:42' -->
<A NAME="page_kc4370_1_6"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate Documents.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Administrative Agent shall have received such documents and certificates as the
Administrative Agent or its counsel may reasonably request relating to the organization, existence and good standing of each Loan Party, the authorization of this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 and any other
legal matters relating to the Loan Parties or this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, all in form and substance satisfactory to the Administrative Agent and its counsel. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Opinion of Counsel to the Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Administrative Agent shall have received a favorable written opinion
(addressed to the Administrative Agent and the Lenders and dated the date hereof) of each of (i)&nbsp;Shearman&nbsp;&amp; Sterling, counsel for the Borrower, substantially in the form of
Exhibit&nbsp;A-1 and (ii)&nbsp;Marc Strassler, Senior Vice President and General Counsel of the Borrower, substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;A-2. The Borrower
hereby requests such counsel to deliver such opinions. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Officer's Certificate.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Administrative Agent shall have received a certificate, dated as of the date
hereof, of the President, a Vice President or a Financial Officer of each Borrower to the effect that (i)&nbsp;no Default has occurred and is continuing as of the date hereof after giving effect to
this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 and (ii)&nbsp;the representations and warranties set forth in Article&nbsp;3 of the Credit Agreement are true and correct in all material respects on and as of the date
hereof after giving effect to this Amendment No.&nbsp;3, except to the extent such representations and warranties specifically relate to an earlier date, in which case such representations and
warranties shall have been true, correct and complete in all material respects on and as of such earlier date and as if each reference in said Article&nbsp;3 to "this Agreement" included reference
to the Credit Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Documents.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such other documents as the Administrative Agent or any Bank or special New York counsel to
Chase may reasonably request. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.03.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fees and Expenses.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
payment to each Lender that consents to, and authorizes the Administrative Agent to execute, this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 not later than 12:00 noon New York time on
January&nbsp;28, 2003, of an amendment fee in an amount equal to 0.25% of the sum of (x)&nbsp;the Revolving Commitment of such Lender on such date </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (y)&nbsp;the aggregate outstanding principal
amount of the Term Loans of such Lender on such date; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;receipt
by the Administrative Agent of all fees and other amounts due and payable on or prior to the date hereof, including, to the extent invoiced, reimbursement or
payment of all out-of-pocket expenses required to be reimbursed or paid by the Borrower hereunder, including without limitation the reasonable fees of Milbank, Tweed,
Hadley&nbsp;&amp; McCloy LLP, counsel for JP Morgan Chase Bank. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loan Documents.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;References in the Loan Documents to "the Credit Agreement" (and indirect
references such as "thereunder", "thereby", "therein" and "thereof") shall be deemed to be a reference to the Credit Agreement as amended hereby. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as herein provided, the Credit Agreement shall remain unchanged and in
full force and effect. This Amendment No.&nbsp;3 may be executed in counterparts which, taken together, shall constitute a single document and any of the parties hereto may execute this Amendment
No.&nbsp;3 by signing any such counterpart. This Amendment No.&nbsp;3 shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the law of the State of New York. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_kc4370_1_7"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 to be duly executed as of the date and year first above written. </FONT></P>

Credit Agreement in each Loan Document to which it is a party shall be a reference to the Credit Agreement as amended by this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 and (3)&nbsp;confirms its obligations under each
Loan Document to which it is a party after giving effect to the amendments set forth in this Amendment No.&nbsp;3. </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-23.1
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2109331zex-23_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 23.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03NYC4370_5">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki4370_exhibit_23.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;23.1    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki4370_independent_auditors__consent"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki4370_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>INDEPENDENT AUDITORS' CONSENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
consent to the incorporation by reference in Registration Statements No.&nbsp;333-46882 on Form&nbsp;S-3, No.&nbsp;333-62008 on
Form&nbsp;S-8 and No.&nbsp;333-56194 on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company"), of our report dated April&nbsp;1, 2003 (which report
expresses an unqualified opinion and include explanatory paragraphs relating to; (a)&nbsp;the Company's completed plan of reorganization and formal exit from Chapter 11 on September&nbsp;19, 2000;
(b)&nbsp;the change in the method of accounting for goodwill and other intangible assets; and (c)&nbsp;the change in the method of accounting for cash consideration received from vendors),
appearing in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc. for the year ended February&nbsp;1, 2003. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>DELOITTE&nbsp;&amp; TOUCHE LLP</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>New
York, New York<BR>
April&nbsp;29, 2003 </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 99.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03NYC4370_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk4370_exhibit_99.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;99.1    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk4370_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk4370_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Certification Pursuant To 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350,    <BR>    <BR>    As Adopted Pursuant To    <BR>    <BR>    Section&nbsp;906 Of The Sarbanes-Oxley Act Of 2002    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
connection with the annual report of Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on Form 10-K for the period ended February&nbsp;1, 2003, as filed with the Securities
and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), I, Eileen R. Scott, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, hereby certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to
Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906 has been provided to the Company and will be retained by the Company and furnished to the Securities and
Exchange Commission or its staff upon request. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A

<A NAME="toc_km4370_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;99.2    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km4370_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km4370_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Certification Pursuant To 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350,<BR>  <BR>    As Adopted Pursuant To<BR>  <BR>    Section&nbsp;906 Of The Sarbanes-Oxley Act Of 2002    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
connection with the annual report of Pathmark Stores,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on Form 10-K for the period ended February&nbsp;1, 2003, as filed with the Securities
and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), I, Frank G. Vitrano, Chief Financial Officer of the Company, hereby certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant
to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906 has been provided to the Company and will be retained by the Company and furnished to the Securities and
Exchange Commission or its staff upon request. </FONT></P>
